description: Former England captain Michael Atherton has urged the ICC to increase transparency in tournament draws and reduce India-Pakistan matches. His call follows political controversies during the 2025 Asia Cup, where the consistent grouping of these teams is driven by significant economic interests. Atherton argues this commercial exploitation is unjustified, advocating for transparent draws regardless of match frequency.

description: Uttar Pradesh's forest department issued "shoot on sight" orders for aggressive wolves in Bahraich district following six deaths and recent injuries. While fresh attacks occurred, one animal killed by villagers was identified as a jackal, not a wolf, adding confusion. Authorities are taking measures to neutralize threats, and a state minister has pledged aid to affected families.

title: IND vs PAK: Pathan trolls Pakistan without naming them - ‘Just another Sunday’
description: India's women's team secured an 88-run victory over arch-rivals Pakistan in the ODI World Cup, marking their fourth consecutive Sunday win against them. The tense match saw no post-game handshake and pre-match controversy, yet India remained composed to top the table. Harleen Deol and Richa Ghosh starred with the bat, while spinners dominated.

description: The facility will freeze and preserve coral larvae — the small, free swimming ‘seeds’ of corals — at very low temperatures. These larvae can later be used to revive damaged reefs or for research, thus protecting genetic diversity that might otherwise be lost

title: Search on as lion goes ‘missing’ inside safari zone at Vandalur Zoo
description: The incident has led to temporary closure of the zone as a precautionary step; officials say it’s not unusual for lions to wander within the safari area

Virat, Rohit get fresh warning: 'They want to play 2027 WC but'
description: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has advised Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to play domestic cricket to maintain game fitness for the 2027 ODI World Cup, citing their reduced international schedule. This comes as Shubman Gill takes over as India's new ODI captain, replacing Rohit Sharma, and will also lead in Tests.

Coldrif row: 14 MP kids given cough syrup fighting for life in Maharashtra hospitals
description: Fourteen children from Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district are critically ill in Nagpur hospitals after consuming the banned Coldrif cough syrup, which caused renal failure. Six earlier deaths at GMCH-Nagpur were confirmed due to diethylene glycol (DEG) toxicity from the contaminated syrup. Maharashtra has banned Coldrif, and Nagpur authorities are advising against prescribing cough syrups to young children.

title: Rahil ends fourth round on a high note at the MIC
Man befriends father’s killer before shooting him dead, say police
Israel-Gaza peace deal: Trump urges all sides to ‘move fast’; warns of ‘massive bloodshed’
description: US President Trump urges swift action on his Israel-Gaza peace initiative, reporting "very positive discussions" with Hamas and other nations for hostage release and ending the war. He warns of "massive bloodshed" if his plan, involving a ceasefire and Hamas disarmament, isn't quickly finalized. Technical teams will meet Monday to clarify details.

Interval walking: 3-minute Japanese technique offers better results than jogging
description: Japanese researchers have unveiled an "Interval Walking Training" method, potentially burning more fat than jogging. This technique involves alternating three minutes of brisk walking with three minutes of slow walking for 30 minutes. This technique activates aerobic and anaerobic systems, triggers excess post exercise oxygen consumption and stimulates mitochondrial activity.

title: George Russell wins in Singapore as McLaren nabs constructors' title
description: Russell finished 5.43 seconds ahead of Red Bull's Verstappen

title: Misfiring Barcelona suffer 4-1 loss at Sevilla
description: Sevilla's first league win over Barcelona since 2015 provisionally lifted them to fourth in the table with 13 points from eight matches

title: Rajasthan high court: Drop 'Maharaj' from petition or case will fall
description: Rajasthan High Court has directed descendants of the former Jaipur royal family to remove "Maharaj" and "Princess" prefixes from their ongoing legal petitions. Justice Mahendra Kumar Goyal set an October 13 deadline, warning that non-compliance would lead to the dismissal of their 24-year-old case.

title: Coldrif tragedy: Doctor held, SIT set up as Madhya Pradesh's 'syrup toll' rises to 14
description: Madhya Pradesh's cough syrup tragedy deepened as three more children died in Chhindwara, raising the toll to 14. A doctor was arrested for prescribing Coldrif, now banned after diethylene glycol was confirmed. An SIT is formed, and a child's body exhumed for autopsy. The manufacturer is also booked as eight children remain hospitalized, highlighting a grave public health crisis.

title: Valmiki: prime sage, premier poet
Horoscope Today, October 6, 2025: Astrological Insights for Scorpio, Gemini, Capricorn, Pisces, and Every Sun Sign
India-US trade talks: New Delhi's 'red lines' must be respected, says Jaishankar
description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar acknowledged "problems" in India-US trade relations, emphasizing India's non-negotiable "red lines" on farmers' interests. He called US tariffs, partly due to Russian oil purchases, "unfair." Despite trade hurdles, Jaishankar affirmed other aspects of the relationship and the Quad remain strong.

title: Haryana Congress leader Brijendra Singh embarks on Sadbhav Yatra” to revive social harmony against BJP’s divisive politics
description: Inspired by Rahul Gandhi’s Bharat Jodo Yatra, the yatra aims to carry forward the Congress’ vision and values directly to the people of Haryana and unify Congress workers and leaders

title: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf’s children: Meet their 2 kids and family life
description: Tennis legends Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf's children, Jaden and Jaz, are making headlines with their distinct lives. Jaden is excelling in baseball, recently earning Pitcher of the Week and representing Germany. Jaz maintains a private life but made rare public appearances at the US Open and visited Germany with her boyfriend.

title: Bengal floods: 28 dead, dozens missing as rain ravages Darjeeling hills
description: Heavy overnight rain caused landslides and flooding in North Bengal. At least 28 people died, mostly in Mirik. Bridges collapsed, isolating towns and stranding tourists. Rescue operations are ongoing in affected areas. The Chief Minister announced immediate assistance. Rivers are flowing above danger levels. Animals fled submerged forests.

title: Mamata’s carnival push as north Bengal reels under floods gives Opposition a handle
description: Leaders from the BJP and CPI(M) raised question as to why the Chief Minister participated in the Durga Puja carnival on Sunday when north Bengal was reeling under floods. Ms. Banerjee will visit north Bengal on Monday

title: Karur Stampede: After Madras high court rap, rash driving FIR slapped on Vijay's driver
description: Tamil Nadu police charged actor-politician Vijay's bus driver for negligent driving. This action followed a Madras High Court query regarding unfiled FIRs for alleged hit-and-run incidents during a Karur stampede. The September 27 event killed 41 people. A police SIT now probes overcrowding and security lapses. The stampede sparked a political row, with parties blaming each other.

title: Cough syrup tragedy: Govt urges states, UTs to strictly comply with revised drug norms
description: Union health secretary Punya Salila Srivastava urged states to enforce strict GMP compliance after child deaths in MP linked to substandard cough syrup. An investigation found 'Coldrif' cough syrup contained excessive Diethylene Glycol, leading to recommended license cancellation and criminal proceedings against the manufacturer. Officials also advised rational use of cough syrups for children.

description: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah controversially declared Lingayat a separate religion, reigniting past allegations of community division. This statement comes amidst internal Lingayat confusion over identifying as a distinct religion or Hindu caste in ongoing surveys. While BJP urges Hindu caste identification, Congress promotes separate religious status.

title: Emergency buy: Army to get 6 AK-630s systems
description: The Indian Army is fast-tracking the acquisition of six mobile AK-630 multi-barrel air defence gun systems to protect border population centres from hostile drones, rockets, and mortars. These 30mm guns, with a 4-6 km range and high rate of fire, will integrate into the Akashteer network.

CEC Gyanesh Kumar declared electoral rolls "purified" after 22 years through a Special Intensive Revision, dismissing opposition charges. Over 68 lakh ineligible voters were removed.

In a poignant moment, Pereira dedicated his victory to Arthur Jones, the recently deceased brother of Jon Jones, who was a former NFL player. This heartfelt tribute resonated deeply, overshadowing the championship win itself.

title: India, UK kick off high-voltage 'Konkan' naval exercise in Indian Ocean
description: India and the UK commenced their major `Konkan` naval exercise in the western Indian Ocean, deploying aircraft carriers, warships, and fighters. Led by INS Vikrant and HMS Prince of Wales, the biennial drills aim to enhance interoperability and reinforce a free and open Indo-Pacific, ahead of British PM Keir Starmer’s visit. This exercise strengthens strategic ties and regional maritime stability.

His interrogation is expected to uncover further links in the terror support network.

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on why he supports Trump's $100,000 H-1B Visa fee
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang supports President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee for fresh applications, calling it a "great start" to reshape immigration policy and attract the "brightest minds." He acknowledges the high cost but believes it sets a meaningful threshold. Critics, however, warn the move could lead to brain drain and undermine America's tech leadership.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX wins contracts worth $714 million from Pentagon
description: The US Space Force awarded SpaceX five of seven critical military launch contracts totaling $714 million, reinforcing its dominance in Pentagon space missions. United Launch Alliance secured the remaining two missions for $428 million. Blue Origin's New Glenn rocket remains uncertified for these National Security Space Launch missions, missing out on this cycle's awards.

title: Hartenstein’s wife Kourtney steps back from glam life for heartfelt reason
description: Kourtney Hartenstein steps down as a ring girl after five years. She now dedicates her time to family, supporting NBA champion husband Isaiah Hartenstein and their young son. Hartenstein plans to attend Oklahoma City Thunder games this season. She also explores new work opportunities, including a family foundation. This marks a new chapter for her.

title: Wayne Gretzky & Janet Jones’ love story: From dance fever to 30 years of marriage
description: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones' enduring love story began with a chance meeting in 1981, reigniting at a 1987 Lakers game. Their shared mindset led to a whirlwind romance, a "royal wedding" in 1988, and a family of five children. They prioritized family, making their decades-long marriage a true victory off the ice.

title: David Montgomery says sister’s accident and nephew’s cancer saved his NFL career
description: Detroit Lions' David Montgomery shared the profound impact of family hardships on his life and career. His sister's paralysis after a car accident and his nephew's battle with leukemia instilled resilience and perspective. Montgomery credits his nephew's simple phone call for saving him during a dark time, emphasizing the importance of family and mental health support.
